intro: Acronychia eriocarpa, commonly known as the rough-leaved acronychia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to northern Australia and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its fruits are woody, spherical drupes that contain a single seed. Acronychia eriocarpa is often found in rainforest or coastal scrub habitats, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
